definition: used as an intensive especially to indicate something unexpected, equal in degree or extent or amount, the latter part of the day; the period of decreasing daylight from late afternoon until nightfall, make even or more even
details:
adverb
- used as an intensive especially to indicate something unexpected
= example: used as an intensive especially to indicate something unexpected
- to a greater degree or extent
= synonyms: yet, still
- in spite of
- to the full extent
= example: to the full extent
adjective
- equal in degree or extent or amount
= synonyms: fifty-fifty
- of the score in a contest
= synonyms: tied
- being level or straight or regular and without variation as e.g. in shape or texture
= example: being level or straight or regular and without variation as e.g. in shape or texture
- divisible by two
- occurring at fixed intervals
= synonyms: regular
- symmetrically arranged
= example: symmetrically arranged
= synonyms: regular
noun
- the latter part of the day; the period of decreasing daylight from late afternoon until nightfall
= example: the latter part of the day; the period of decreasing daylight from late afternoon until nightfall
= synonyms: eve
verb
- make even or more even
= synonyms: even out
- become even or more even
= example: become even or more even
= synonyms: even out
- make level or straight
= synonyms: flush
